TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed WindowsAccountType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of Windows account used.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WindowsAccountType enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity> class.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity> class for the user represented by the specified Windows account token, the specified authentication type, and the specified Windows account type. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity> class.
[!code-cs[System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity_AllMembers#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.princi_2_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity_AllMembers#7](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.princi_2_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity_AllMembers#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.princi_2_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Principal.WindowsAccountType Anonymous = int32(3)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Principal.WindowsAccountType Guest = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Principal.WindowsAccountType Normal = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Principal.WindowsAccountType System = int32(2)
